data.scheme_name: Uttar Pradesh Pharmaceutical and Medical Devices Industry Policy, 2023 - Environment Protection Subsidy - Zero Waste Incentive-new
data.benefits: Scheme provides an interest subsidy on loan taken to set up infrastructure to the extent of 50% of annual interest for 5 years, capped at Rs 10 lakhs.
data.eligibility: All units engaged in Pharmaceutical and Medical Devices sector are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions: All incentives, including reimbursements, subsidies, and exemptions, will be subject to a maximum limit of 100% of the fixed capital investment made by MSMEs in the Pharma and Medical Device Sector.
data.beneficiaries: All units engaged in Pharmaceutical and Medical Devices sector are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites: All incentives, including reimbursements, subsidies, and exemptions, will be subject to a maximum limit of 100% of the fixed capital investment made by MSMEs in the Pharma and Medical Device Sector.
data.context:
• The pharmaceutical and medical device industry is key to improving public health through research and innovation. Efforts are being made to build modern parks for manufacturing pharmaceuticals, medical devices, and cosmetics, with a focus on enhancing research, infrastructure, and attracting top talent. 
  • The initiative also supports intellectual property creation and boosts funding for R&D. 
  • Additionally, there is a push to promote AYUSH healthcare by encouraging the research and production of AYUSH products.
data.objective:
• The policy aims to support industry growth by offering subsidies and land for manufacturing units. 
  • It also plans to set up advanced research facilities and collaborate with academic institutions to boost innovation. 
  • The goal is to maximize the sector’s potential, attract investments, create jobs, and promote economic growth in the state.
data.description: New individual pharma units adopting water recycling/harvesting and zero discharge technology can receive an interest subsidy of 50% on loans for such infrastructure for 5 years, capped at INR 10.00 lakhs annually
data.how_to_apply: Applicants can apply on the below mentioned portal Portal link- https://my.msme.gov.in/MyMsme/Reg/COM_IprReim.aspx
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get incentives after the approval from the concerned authority.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Voter’s ID Card / Passport / Driving License / PAN Card / Signature identification from present bankers of proprietor, partner of director (if a company) 
2. Proof of residence: Recent telephone bills, electricity bill, property tax receipt /Passport / voter’s ID Card of Proprietor, partner of Director (if a company)
Note: As per SIDBI’s KYC application form for Individuals 
3. Proof of business Address - As per SIDBI’s KYC application form for Non-  Individuals
4. Memorandum and articles of association of the Company / Partnership Deed of partners etc.
5. Bio data of promoters / Guarantors (as per enclosed format I)
6. Net Worth Statement of promoters and guarantors along with latest income tax returns (as per enclosed format II).
7. Rent Agreement (if business premises on rent) and clearance from pollution control board if applicable
8. Udyog Aadhar memorandum (UAM) registration if applicable.
9. Projected balance sheets for the next two years in case of working capital limits and for the period of the loan in case of term loan 
10. Photocopies of lease deeds/ title deeds of all the properties being offered as primary and collateral securities.
11. Documents to establish whether the applicant belongs to SC/ST Category, wherever applicable
12. Certificate of incorporation from ROC to establish whether majority stake holding in the company is in the hands of a person who belongs to SC/ST/Woman category. 
13. Profile of the unit (includes names of promoters, other directors in the company, key technical / managerial staff, the activity being undertaken addresses of all offices and plants, shareholding pattern etc
14. Last three years balance sheets of the Associate / Group Companies (if any).
15. Detailed Project Report
16. Manufacturing process if applicable, major profile of executives in the company, any tie-ups, details about raw material used and their suppliers, details about the buyers, details about major-competitors and the company’s strength and weaknesses as compared to their competitors etc.
The check list is only indicative and not exhaustive and depending upon the local requirements at different places addition could be made as per (necessity).
